description.narrative: Sverige kommer att ge kärnstöd till Women’s Law Centre (WLC), en civilsamhällsorganisation baserad i Moldavien, under perioden juni 2016 - juni 2019. Kärnstöd ges för att stärka WLC´s organisatoriska kapacitet och för att bidra till implementeringen av deras strategiska plan 2016-2018 för att bekämpa våld i Moldavien. Målet och det förväntade resultatet av kärnstödet är att WLC skall bidra till att bygga ett samhälle där människor kan leva fria från våld och känna sig säkra inom sina familjer och förhållanden.

Sweden will support Women's Law Centre (WLC), a civil society organisation from Moldova, to implement core support activities provided by WLC’s Strategic Plan and RAF during June 2016 - June 2019. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of WLC’s medium term Strategic Plan 2016-2018 in fighting domestic violence in Moldova. The main objective and expected result of core activities is that the Women’s Law Center contributes to building a community where people live their life free of violence and abuse and are safe and protected in their families and relationships.

Sweden supports Women's Law Centre (WLC), a civil society organisation from Moldova, to implement core support activities provided by the institutional Strategic Plan and RAF during June 2016 - June 2019. Core support is granted to strengthen institutional capacities and to assist the implementation of WLC’s medium term Strategic Plan 2016-2019 in fighting domestic violence in Moldova. The WLC has become a support centre for victims of gender-based and domestic violence. The organisation promotes a holistic approach in assisting its beneficiaries. Beside legal empowerment and representation in courts, the organisation provides psychological counselling and social assistance to the victims. The organisation shares the view that only a comprehensive assistance may contribute to the victims’ breaking the circle of violence and having a future free of violence. Throughout years of activity, the organisation has set clear objectives and activities on change management focusing on developing and implementing projects with ownership. The WLC analyses legislative proposals on gender equality, gender-based violence and domestic violence and other problems of special importance for women, effectively conducts competent analyses of public policies related to domestic violence, monitors implementation of the legislation on gender-based violence and domestic violence and gender equality, including by extensive monitoring initiatives. The organisation is actively involved in monitoring the implementation of international conventions and agreements signed and/or ratified by the Republic of Moldova, which affect particularly women.

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

description.narrative: The assessment is that WLC achieved excellently the objectives set up for the core support. This is one of the best partner that the Embassy had in this phase of the programme. During 2016-2019, WLC developed and WLC Administration Board approved the following financial and accounting policies:- Financial audit policy approved by the decision of Administration Board of 27.07.2016- Property inventory procedure approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 28.06.2017- Business travels procedure approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 28.06.2017- Procedure on acquisition of goods and services approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 25.09.2017- Procedure of financial means use approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 25.09.2017- Procedure of material goods record approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 25.09.2017- Procedure on the record and use of materials approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 25.09.2017- Procedure on financial planning and reporting approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 15.12.2017- Procedure on salary payment approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 15.12.2017- Procedure on awarding grants approved by the decision of the Administration Board of 19.07.2018. The organisation developed and started applying procedures streamlining the internal management, such as:- human resource management procedure defining the processes of staff recruitment, selection and employment, performance evaluation, and staff professional development;- project management manual describing the procedure for projects planning and implementation, monitoring and evaluation and closure;- risks management policy setting risk levels and the obligation for all staff members to work on the risks registry and regularly update it;- anti-fraud and conflict of interests policy describing the measures to prevent fraud and conflict of interests, and the procedure to report and examine such cases;- code of ethics and conduct setting clear principles and rules of conduct in internal and external relations and communication by staff members. System-based Audit Report by SDA of 30 April 2015 triggered in the WLC processes targeting improvement of financial management and internal operations of the organisation. WLC developed an Action Plan based on the SBA recommendations. The actions were grouped into priority SDA recommendations, important SDA recommendations, and suggestions. By the end of the core support, WLC managed to fully implement the priority and important SDA recommendations:- WCL established a Board and convened Board meeting four time per year;- WCL amended the Statute to avoid staff members and consultants being Board members, to ensure Executive Director’s reporting to the Board and that the General Assembly approves and excludes members;- WCL developed RAF and update it regularly with data;- WCL commissioned external audits confirming reliability of financial statements;- WCL developed and the Board approved all recommended policies and procedures, etc. Gender Following the training on gender mainstreaming, WLC conducted a gender analysis, where we stated that women’s rights are a top priority for the WLC, which considers gender equality to be a cornerstone of society, where women and men enjoy the same rights and opportunities across all sectors of society, including economic participation and decision-making, and when the different behaviours, aspirations and needs of women and men are equally valued and favoured. Considering the profile of survivors accessing WLC services, in particular, that most of the service beneficiaries are from urban area, and that the access of women to such services in rural areas is limited, we decided to leave no one behind and to extend the services to rural areas and to start with Gagauzia known for its strong patriarchal culture. Environment WLC took efforts to mainstream environment into its work by developing an Environment Policy and sharing it with all staff members. The policy will be discussed with and approved by the Board. Examples of environment-friendly practices WLC applies:- saving energy by using led lights;- turning off the lights when not necessary;- using natural light when possible;- turning off all electric appliances when leaving the office;- avoiding printing documents, however, when printing, applying two-sided printing;- recycling of waste paper;- avoiding the use of plastic in the office and during events; replacement of plastic by paper, glass and porcelain;- purchasing ecologically certified hygiene products. Conflict In 2018, WLC team developed its new Strategic Development Plan for 2019-2024 and the conflict perspective was seriously considered. The team considered the conflict from several point of view: gendered conflict and its implications on the society and on the strategic direction of the organisation, and external and internal conflicts and their impact on the organisation. Based on the integrated conflict perspective, the team analysed the risks that might impede the implementation of each area in the strategy and considered how the planned activities might affect the conflict context.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
